result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeremy M Papadakis-Schneider appeared by video.  Attorney Mindy M. Nolan appeared by video for Jeremy M Papadakis-Schneider.  Attorney Tristan Bednarek appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a DPA hearing. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Jeremy M Papadakis-Schneider appeared by video.  Attorney Mindy M. Nolan appeared by video for Jeremy M Papadakis-Schneider.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a plea and sentencing hearing. Defendant may be eligible for a DPA. Defense counsel requests a DPA hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Jeremy M Papadakis-Schneider in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Jeremy M Papadakis-Schneider in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Defense counsel informs court that they are awaiting discovery materials, and further requests a Scheduling Conference date. Case adjourned for a Scheduling Conference to Br 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 066299,
Payable Number: 1019890,
Receipt Number: 22RP028561,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (7/13/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with C.A.D.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Jeremy M Papadakis-Schneider in court.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Status Conference in Branch 29.  Status conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
